Key Arguments: The legislation amounts to government censorship of media and private individuals.
The ACMA's power to make rules is equivalent to making its own laws, which is undemocratic.
The legislation disguises censorship as coming from platforms rather than the government.
Truth is subjective and can change over time; no small group should decide what is true.
The legislation threatens free speech and democratic principles by silencing dissenting voices.
Notable Quotes: Government should not be in the business of censoring the media, or private individuals, which is what this amounts to.
This is nothing more than tyranny and totalitarianism.
A small group of people should not get to decide whether something is true or not, and silence the voices of people who dissent.
